title: sheen change reasoning doesn't add up
body: Riots stated in the reasoning for getting rid of AP from sheen was "Removing AP and adding cooldown reduction adds more synergies for the champions who want the Spellblade passive without forcing an often-'wasted' stat on them" but they left the sapphire crystal which gives mana. There are plenty of champs that benefit from sheen that don't even have mana. How is that not a wasted stat?

replies.body:
Mana on an item makes it less attractive to manaless users. AP on an item makes it less attractive to AD champs (though many do have AP scalings).

Neither of these things are wrong. It's simply a matter of who you want to market an item towards. Riot decided they wanted to market sheen towards mana users, and Trinity towards AD mana users. If their goal were to market it towards manaless ADs, they'd change the build path and remove the mana. 

Point is, it's a design choice, not an accident.

Sheen is an item that you benefit from when you use abilities due to Spellblade.

CDR and Mana are two stats which help you use abilities more frequently due to lowing ability cooldowns and increasing your resources (mana).

Manaless champions don't need the increase in resources since they have no long-term limit to their ability usage (unless it is specific to their resource type).  While they don't benefit from mana, that is because their abilities don't have any mana cost which removes the long-term limit on their ability usage.

While AP does help some abilities, it only benefits champions with AP scalings.

If a champion such as Talon or Vayne wanted to purchase Sheen/Trinity Force for extra burst damage (just as an example), then they would be wasting the AP.

CDR benefits abilities no matter how they scale (with the exception of passive and toggled abilities).  In addition, CDR works better with Sheen's concept; it provides mana so that you can use more abilities and it provides CDR so you can use abilities more often, both of which synergize with Spellblade.

a mana-less champion isn't going to benefit from any of the items that grant them mana because they don't scale with it. an ap-less champion will still benefit from items that happen to have ap on them but won't use all of the stats they grant; they don't use it as efficiently but still benefit from having it.

That's not how mana works for anybody, except Singed and Ryze.

Mana is a gate resource, AP is a scaling resource. You buy mana items either to have more resource to throw around in fights (common for tanks to get Frozen Heart or Iceborn Gauntlet), but also because most of those items have other effects (FH attack speed reduction, Iceborn slow fields). Resourceless champions aren't supposed to benefit from it; because they're investing gold into an item that grants a resource they don't have. You CAN buy these items for their passives, but if you are manaless, then you won't get full use out of it, and this is fair; you don't have a resource to begin with. If you want to dip into these items, accept that you won't use the gold you sunk into their mana costs.

AP is for scaling on abilities for the champions that have those ratios. Champions who are not primarily AP will get nothing out of building it; Vayne does not use Deathcap or Luden's well, because she doesn't synergize with it at all. At best, these champs will get Zhonya's to cheese an assassin, or maybe a Liandry's in special cases (Mundo).  AP is not a gate; mana is.

A champion who has no resource and invests into Sheen will still take advantage of both the CDR and the spellblade. They are able to use it efficiently, but not as efficiently as someone who has mana. A champion with no AP ratios will get much less out  of sinking gold into AP items because they can do nothing with the offensive stats provided.

Champions without AP-scalings may benefit from AP items due to the other stats, actives and passives that they provide.

Champions without mana may benefit from mana items due to the other stats, actives and passives that they provide.

If you are suggesting that they created an item specifically for energy champions (Zed, Lee Sin, Akali, Kennen, Shen), then that entirely depends on Riot deciding that it's a good idea.  Riot has said in the past that they wouldn't create such an item because the item would be useful on an extremely small number of champions who have specifically been balanced around not having items to increase their resource pool.

Would the item's existence be fair to mana-using champions though?  Yes, it would provided that the stats, actives, and passives on the item are balanced in comparison to other items.  They don't have to purchase the item, they have many other options which may provide useful and/or more optimal stats, and they could purchase the item anyways if they decided whatever the item provided it was worth wasting a small amount of gold on a resource they don't use.
